args.natural_language_statement:
Let p be a prime. Prove that if G is a finite group with exactly one Sylow p-subgroup, then that Sylow p-subgroup is normal in G.

Translate to Lean4: state a theorem that for a group G (finite), prime p, and a subgroup P which is a Sylow p-subgroup, if P is the unique Sylow p-subgroup of G then P is normal in G. End the theorem statement with := by sorry.

retrieved_examples.nl: If G is a finite group and P is a Sylow p-subgroup, then any conjugate of P is also a Sylow p-subgroup.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem sylow_conj_is_sylow {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P) (g : G) : IsSylow p (g • P) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: If a subgroup P is unique Sylow p-subgroup then it is normal.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem unique_sylow_is_normal {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P) (huniq : ∀ Q : Subgroup G, IsSylow p Q → Q = P) : P.Normal := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: In a finite group, Sylow p-subgroups are conjugate to each other.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem sylow_subgroups_conjugate {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P Q : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P) (hQ : IsSylow p Q) : ∃ g : G, g • P = Q := by sorry

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open MulAction Subgroup
open Pointwise

/-- state a theorem that for a group G (finite), prime p, and a subgroup P which is a Sylow p-subgroup, if P is the unique Sylow p-subgroup of G then P is normal in G. End the theorem statement with := by sorry. -/
theorem unique_sylow_is_normal {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P) (huniq : ∀ Q : Subgroup G, IsSylow p Q → Q = P) : P.Normal := by so

args.content:
import Mathlib
open MulAction Subgroup
open Pointwise

/-- state a theorem that for a group G (finite), prime p, and a subgroup P which is a Sylow p-subgroup, if P is the unique Sylow p-subgroup of G then P is normal in G. End the theorem statement with := by sorry. -/
theorem unique_sylow_is_normal {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P) (huniq : ∀ Q : Subgroup G, IsSylow p Q → Q = P) : P.Normal := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- If a finite group G has a unique Sylow p-subgroup, that Sylow p-subgroup is normal. -/
theorem unique_sylow_is_normal {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) (P : Sylow p G)
  (huniq : ∀ Q : Sylow p G, Q = P) : (P.toSubgroup).Normal := by sorry
